Posted By: Reishyn (8/10/2013 12:36:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Maybe it's just me, but I feel like there are a couple of artworks that are quite creepy, but don't appear to be as much within the modern card frame. It's like the orderly frame can 'de-creep' the art.  
This printing would be such a case - I feel like this artwork would be more intimidating in the old frame.  
Likewise, I imagine [Abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=2084) for example would be less frightening (albeit just as disgusting) in a modern frame.
posts.html:

Posted By: Sironos (7/23/2013 6:10:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is an absolutely awesome artwork.   
  
This is I feel a perfect card to use as reference for "How do we make cards look enough like homages to the old art styles while using the new styles to match better the more shiny new cards?" I mean honestly compare the Xth Nightmare to the Alpha Nightmare to THIS Nightmare, and it's immediately obvious that the Xth one is the worst art of the lot, just because this is so much like the Alpha art and it's a very tough call between the two.   
  
I really, really want to see more art directions say "Look at M14 Nightmare. Do that, only for this card. Make it look New, the Old-Fashioned way." I think it can even be applied to cards that don't yet have old-fashioned artworks!  
  
In fact I'm going to have to write into Jeremy Jarvis about this one. Who did that? Vance....Kovaks? (squinting) Yeah he's a cool man. A very cool man.  
  
Nightmare is awesome because I think it's one of the first cards that really really scales in power with "Shock Logic"-- ie, it... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

I mean honestly compare the Xth Nightmare to the Alpha Nightmare to THIS Nightmare, and it's immediately obvious that the Xth one is the worst art of the lot, just because this is so much like the Alpha art and it's a very tough call between the two.

I really, really want to see more art directions say "Look at M14 Nightmare. Do that, only for this card. Make it look New, the Old-Fashioned way." I think it can even be applied to cards that don't yet have old-fashioned artworks!

In fact I'm going to have to write into Jeremy Jarvis about this one. Who did that? Vance....Kovaks? (squinting) Yeah he's a cool man. A very cool man.
